I‚Äôm a dad of 3. I share custody with my ex. Before my split, I owned a house and my credit was in the high 700‚Äôs. Plenty of offers for c/c. It made life easier/better. Christmas, birthday vacations , random emergencies could be handled and slowly paid off.
The divorce was brutal leaving me, among other things, in financial ruin. It‚Äôs been over 5 years and I have built a nice life for me and my kids. The only thing that still plagued me was my credit. Credit that my ex destroyed. (I know, I know. Poor me)

I‚Äôm in a better situation now with a good job. I pay my bills, taxes, etc. yet no company would give me a chance to prove I can be trusted again with a line of credit.
Holidays, bdays became much more..limited. Vacations were non existent. And random emergencies were simply not allowed!

AVANT is giving me the chance to feel more secure in life. Much more able to truly enjoy the small things that are often overlooked when money is a constant worry.

reviewTitle: Excellent customer support and a very‚Ä¶
reviewDescription: Excellent customer support and a very good credit card thank you üôè

TL;DR: Questionable applications opened & poor customer service. Transparency is the issue.


I was offered a 2% rewards card if I applied and opened a new account with Avant through Credit Karma. I did as told. I discovered that two applications were opened when I applied in February 2024.

This concerned me; so,I emailed Avant support asking if the card I was approved for was still a rewards card. (I hadn‚Äôt received anything in the mail yet.) I was told to call. I did. I was told that it was in fact the rewards card. I also was told via email that I would receive a separate email verifying the rewards portion. I never did. I tried emailing again and received another ‚Äòcall support‚Äô response. So I did. Then the system was down; no help again.

I decided to make an approximate $15 purchase to see if any rewards would generate. Nothing. I called again today (05March2024) and was told that it wasn‚Äôt a rewards card and that I can‚Äôt have two cards. I tried to explain that I only applied for the one. I was given a scripted response. I asked for a supervisor. I was told one wasn‚Äôt available and to request a callback when one was. I then closed my account.

I will not work with a company that cannot provide a straight answer; especially when it appears that two applications were opened at once without my consent. If you never have to ask for support, this card will be ideal.

Please improve communication.

reviewTitle: I wouldn't even give 1 star if not for‚Ä¶
reviewDescription: I wouldn't even give 1 star if not for wanting to review. I have this card and i have made at least 4 payments on a $500 credit limit .I made a payment online in January no problem,then i made my scheduled payment of $25 on Febuary 17th ON TIME & OVER THE PHONE TO A CUSTOMER SERVICE REP. THOUGHT EVERYTHING WAS GOOD ....BUT THEN YESTERDAY I GET A LETTER STATING I OWED $64 INCLUDING A $25 LATE CHARGE ...I PAYED MY PAYMENT DUE ON THE 17TH & IT IS THE 28TH... SO I GET ON THE PHONE AND THIS BEGAN MY HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE WITH THESE PPL THAT COULD BARELY SPEAK ENGLISH .....SO THE CSR LOOKED UP MY INFO AND TELLS ME THAT YES IT IS SHOWING THAT I MADE A PAYMENT ON FEBRUARY 17TH AND THEN IT WAS CANCELED....UUUMMM NO MA'AM I DID NOT CANCEL ANYTHING...WHY IN THE HELL WOULD I MAKE A PAYMENT, BY PHONE TO AN AGENT, AND THEN CANCEL IT ...I HAVE OVERDRAFT SO THERE WAS NO CHANCE THE MONEY WASN'T THERE....WELL THIS WOMAN ARGUED ME DOWN THAT IT WAS ME OR MY BANK THAT DID THIS NOT THEM ...OK SO I WENT TO THE BANK AND THERE WAS NO SIGN OF ANY TRANSACTION TO THEM ON THAT DATE ,I CALL BACK AND A DIFFERENT RUDE AGENT PROCEEDED TO TELL ME THE SAME THING AS THE FIRST RUDE WOMAN ...NOW MIND YOU THE FIRST THING THEY SAY IS "YOUR CALL IS BEING RECORDED FOR SECURITY PURPOSES" SO I TELL THEM OK I SHOULD'VE BEEN RECORDED MAKING MY PAYMENT TO YOUR AGENT RIGHT ....NO THEY TELL ME NO MA'AM WE CAN'T FIND WHO IT WAS WITH ...BUT THEY CAN SEE WHERE I PAID TO AN AGENT WITH A DEBIT CARD ...THEN CANCELED IT THE SAME DAY ü§î I CALL BS ...YES I GOT IRATE AT THIS POINT AND I USE QUITE A FEW "COLORFUL" WORDS BECAUSE THESE PPL ARE JUST RIDICULOUSLY RUDE & FOR THE LOVE OF GOD CAN ANYBODY IN THERE SPEAK DECENT ENGLISH !!!! SO I JUST FINALLY SCREAM TO THIS RUDE & CLUELESS WOMAN THAT I WOULD BE PAYING THIS CARD OFF TODAY MARCH 1ST & THEY CAN COUNT ON ME TELLING EVERYBODY TO NOT APPLY FOR THIS CARD
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. reviewTitle: I had been paying on my loan for six‚Ä¶
reviewDescription:
I had been paying on my loan for six months. I refinanced the loan. I got the new information about loan how much from what account and it never gave me a due date. I thought the new amount would be deducted the same day that it has been deducted for the previous six months. I went to store and looked like a total fool when my account was 480 dollars in the hole. I looked and seen Avant had moved my due date to the 20th and pulled the money two days earlier. When I called Avant the lady rudely informed me that the due date last month was the 20th and the 20th of this month. Zero Empathy. She ewas an ass and said it would be on the new agreement. I went back through my emails and Avant on December 19th, 2023 sent me an email outlining everything.
The current balance, the additional funds, the admin fee, the new total, and the funding date. Nothing about a new due date. I am a simple person, I wish that if you were going to make changes to my automatic payment it would have been pre-approved and not done without my knowledge. Also why would you change the due date that had been previously set for half a year before. Frustrated to be in the hole for two days before payday! I know Avant doesn't give a care, pass on the blame to me, even though I have been making this payment on the 22nd for six prior months. You don't care because you aren't having to not feed your family for two days. Just pissed about this situation
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewDescription: They made things very easy and the customer service was really good I loved my experience

Made a payment on 1/10/24 for $200.00 to go towards my Feb 24 payment because I was going out of town on business, got back and found a email that my Feb payment was late and that a late fee was added. I then made another $100.00 payment (online) and called customer (lousy) service. As soon as someone picked up the phone the first thing I heard was my MIRANDA RIGHTS that this is attempt to collect a debt...(wait - what debt?) tolld them I had made the payment on 1/10 and another one on 2/14. They said the payment on 1/10 went to my balance and they have no record of the 2/14 payment (yet) though my back said it was already pending. explained the problem and said there is nothing they could do about the 1/10 payment because it had been made (24 HRS) to soon...WAIT WHAT?. and the the late charge will stand and that there is nothing they could do about it. Asked to talk to a supervisor, only to placed on hold for over 25 min and nothing. I have emailed them multiple times and after 2 days nothing. Told to cancel the card and would just pay if off, but that I would NOT pay either the late charge nor the annual fee since the card would not be used in the coming year. If you have a problem with them, customer service is NO help at all and emailing them is just as bad.


Supplement....
After nearly 3 weeks...Avant finally responded, all it is - is a canned response, no thoughts and still they want you to reach out to them...like I have multiple times already, and all I get is just lip service and no action. Hey AVANT...here's an idea...get off you computer and act like a human and maybe, I don't know...maybe call the customer. you sure expect the customer to do it and do your job.
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewTitle: During the application process I was‚Ä¶
reviewDescription:
During the application process I was required to submit my banking account information login to them through a third party.

Absolutely NOT! Now my application is unfinished and my credit score negatively impacted for no reason.

Avant says applying won‚Äôt affect your credit score. False. I received a hard inquiry and my score dropped five points.


Avant‚Äôs reply states a soft inquiry won‚Äôt affect my score. Sure.

But I got a hard inquiry because you denied my application because I refused to give a third party my bank account sign in information.

That was never listed as a requirement.
I would never in this day and age provide my online banking access to a credit card company or any company.

This is completely unacceptable business practices, Avant is predatory and dishonest. I should have trusted the negative reviews.

Even Avant‚Äôs reply is deceptive.
I received a hard inquiry.
Yet notice their reply starts off with a completely useless fact that doesn‚Äôt apply to this situation, obviously in an attempt to negate my factual experience.

I just double checked, and there is a hard inquiry‚Ä¶ Please contact credit bureau and remove the inquiry Avant.
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear about your situation. A soft inquiry is conducted upon submission of your inquiry for credit. Please be advised that a soft credit inquiry will not affect your credit score and is not visible to other creditors. However, upon submission of your application for final review, each customer is required to acknowledge and consent to a hard credit inquiry. Note that rates are determined on an individual basis and are based on a number of factors including your credit score and repayment history, among others. If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact us at Support@Avant.com and we will promptly address your concerns.

reviewTitle: If you have a PO Box mailing address don't get this card!
reviewDescription:
If you have a PO Box mailing address, do not get this card. I was instantly approved for a credit card after applying on Credit Karma. When filling out the account information, I put down my permanent address. I was expecting to be able to add a different PO Box mailing address later on, as I live in a town that only uses PO Boxes and does not offer street deliveries for mail.

I sent an email to ask for my mailing address to be updated. I was told this is against the policy they have for addresses (PO Boxes are not allowed to be set as an address on your account).

I sent another email explaining I just wanted to update my mailing address, not my physical address. I was told to call in to speak with someone.

I called in and was told having the credit card mailed to my PO Box is not possible. I asked to speak to a manager at least three times; I was ignored and was told repeatedly what I wanted was not possible. I finally gave up and told them to close my account. They proceeded to close my account, and I asked again to speak to a manager. After an almost 10-minute hold, I am informed the manager is "on a call" and they can leave a message. I had my account with this company for a grand total of one day! Not worth the headache.
Date of experience: January 11, 2024

reviewTitle: Title: Beware of AvantCard: Unresponsive Customer Service and Hidden Fees
reviewDescription:
I recently applied for the AvantCard, hoping to build my credit. However, the experience turned into a nightmare from the very beginning. After receiving the card, I attempted to activate it, but it wouldn't work. Despite multiple attempts through the online portal and calls to customer service, the issue remained unresolved.

Customer service was unhelpful and unresponsive. After waiting on hold for extended periods, I finally reached a representative who failed to activate the card and couldn't explain the problem. Frustrated and unable to use the card, I decided to cancel it.

To my shock and dismay, the representative informed me that I was still responsible for the annual fee, even though the card never worked. They refused to waive the fee or offer any form of compensation for the inconvenience and time wasted.

When I requested to speak to a manager, I was astonishingly told that they didn't have one available. This lack of accountability and escalation options further highlighted the company's unprofessionalism and disregard for customer concerns.

Avoid AvantCard at all costs! Their non-functional card, poor customer service, hidden fees, and lack of accountability make them a terrible choice for anyone seeking a credit card. Be wary of their misleading offers and save yourself the frustration and financial hassle I experienced.
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewTitle: Do yourself a favor and stay away
reviewDescription: It takes up to 10 days for anything to post to your account. You cannot see any transactions for a month. So good luck catching fraud. I called to check my balance before I made a transaction and it's not accurate. I called to see why my account was showing negative and no one could tell me any transactions or see anything on my account to even help me. The first representative told me they don't post the over balance to the credit bureau and that it wasn't going to hurt my credit. Same morning they reported to the credit bureau and I lost a ton of points. I called back to see what happened and they still can't see anything on my account. I asked them to remove it from my report. The lady says she needs to get a supervisor but none are available. Then asks when someone can call me back . I said today asap. And then the lady says remember you can log into your account online to check on your information - but you literally can't and that was part of the reason I called. Literally the worst credit card I've ever had. I wouldn't recommend to anyone. For a company that's supposedly giving credit cards to help build credit it seems highly negligent to not allow the card holder accurate and up to date information on their account and balances. Up to 10 days to post to your account - really!? I recommend people to stay away from this company.
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewTitle: This review to express my‚Ä¶poor custmer service
reviewDescription:
This review to express my dissatisfaction, with the customer service provided by Avant Money. My recent experience in trying to pay off a loan has been incredibly frustrating. I feel it's important to share my concerns.

I started the loan repayment process seven weeks ago. Despite my efforts I'm still waiting for a confirmation letter in the mail confirming that the loan has been fully paid off. This delay is not just inconvenient. Also has implications for my mortgage application, which is now being unnecessarily delayed.

I've called Avant Money times over the seven weeks to inquire about the status of the letter. Unfortunately, every time I call they inform me that the letter is "on its way." The lack of a resolution and constant delays in receiving the documentation are causing me a lot of distress and inconvenience.

In an attempt to escalate this matter I requested a callback, from a manager. To my disappointment they informed me that it would take 48 hours for this process. Unfortunately, I still haven't received any callback yet further prolonging the resolution of this issue and adding to my frustration.
The customer service team, at Avant Money is incredibly inefficient and unresponsive which is completely unacceptable. This does not affect my commitments but also specifically impacts my mortgage application.

I strongly urge Avant Money to address this problem and find a solution to the delays in providing the paperwork. This experience has not damaged my perception of Avant Money. Has also raised concerns about the dependability and effectiveness of their customer service procedures.

I sincerely hope that my feedback prompts an examination of your customer service practices ensuring that others do not encounter difficulties, in the future.
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewTitle: I tried to get a loan from this‚Ä¶
reviewDescription: I tried to get a loan from this company. For almost a week, her employees called me at any time they wanted, although I asked to call me at 1pm so that it would not be while I was working in the office. During the call, I can hear almost nothing, since in the background of the conversation of their employee, other conversations and other noises are constantly heard, obviously their company does not know anything about noise reduction. Every day they asked me for more and more information, they even called on Saturday and Sunday. On Sunday during the call, I asked how I could cancel this application, after which the agent still asked questions, she agreed that the additional information she requested was not needed, and said that I would need to check the status of my case in my cabinet and see if it was needed more documents. On Sunday evening I saw that more documents were needed, and on Monday I saw that my application was cancelled. When I called the company and asked why my application was canceled and how to resume it, the agent told me that I canceled my application and if I wanted, I could fill out a new form and that since 7 days had not yet passed, my application would be renewed. When I did this, I received a message that they could not provide me with a loan at this time. Terrible experience with this company!
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewTitle: Very easy and received my money right‚Ä¶
reviewDescription: Very easy and received my money right away I would highly recommend.

I was approved for $2000 through a Credit Karma offer with their score of about 660. There were different choices at different times, such as 0%, 1%, 2% and 3% back, since I visit that site frequently. When I saw the 3% populate this last time, I registered for their soft-pull on credit, then finalized it shortly after that approval.

The card arrived promptly and I believe I had some issue activating online, so I used the phone and prompts to do that. I registered my account online and monitor my purchases and payments there. I made multiple purchases nearly immediately at places such as stores and online shopping, even a membership to a social website, as well as my annual phone bill (yep, I pay 1 year in advance); a wide variety of purchases.

In 2 statements, I‚Äôve made 14 purchases and made 5 payments. I am set up for reoccurring automatic payments, but I don‚Äôt wait that long. Once you make a payment, if it is over the minimum due for the month, your reoccurring payment is not deducted, because the system knows you have already made that minimum payment, if the minimum is what you are set up to pay. More simply, it does not double dip if you already paid. If you set it to pay your balance, I need not explain that.

The only negative I can think of is that they show your purchases and payments as ‚Äúpending‚Äù for at least a day, so you have to do the math yourself to determine your real balance. I‚Äôm used to a credit union where transactions are immediate. Pending means you did it, so I don‚Äôt get that.

I have not experienced any problems at all with Avant, and I get 3% back. I‚Äôm not addressing others‚Äô problems I‚Äôve read about, because I haven‚Äôt had those. They email me about my account, when it is due and when I make a payment. I have replaced my debit card with this card, and I just pay it off as I would have done if I had used a debit card. That is why I make so many payments, and I wanted to make sure they take multiple payments, which they do.

Sometimes I come home from the store and make a payment for what I just bought. This basically cuts my sales tax nearly in half, as long as I pay it off every month. I make at least one payment a week. I‚Äôm used to not having a credit card, so that part is a habit to keep. I'll never raise my score if I carry balances on a card, and neither will you.

Don‚Äôt ruin your credit again by using this or any card as a luxury. Don‚Äôt buy things you couldn‚Äôt otherwise pay cash for. Don't tell yourself, "It's only $19.95", just don't. Don‚Äôt limit your payments to the minimum; pay the entire balance and get used to it. If you must pay a minimum (I get that), pay more no matter how much more. There‚Äôs nothing better than looking at your account online and seeing the balance is $0 with a payment due of nothing.
Straightforward easy application process. Quick turnaround time and would recommend.

reviewDescription:
Amazing company! Very fast and reliable. Have used them 2 times and both fully online. I had to pull 1st loan to repair my car. A year later which is now, I applied for more money to consolidate all my debts. Applied on the 5th (thurs) of the month, online, received approval on 6th (Fri) of the month by email, also letting me know I would receive funds on the (Tues) 10th but noticed I received the money in my bank actually on Saturday, the 7th penning, then posted on the 10th. 9th Monday was a holiday. I remember my first loan was pretty fast too. So basically if I didn‚Äôt spot over the weekend I‚Äôd say from the time you apply it can be 1-4 days. I think my first loan funded by 2nd day and that‚Äôs because I had very little debts.

Anyway I was drowning in monthly minimums so this was the best experience because now I just have 1 bill and was able to choose if I wanted long term minimum or short term.

Highly recommend them if you need a loan! Excellent experience. I‚Äôve never had to speak to a customer service rep. I selected autopay and now I‚Äôm all set. The 1st bill will be due exactly one month after your fund date, so mine is the 10th every month.

Hope this was helpful, I was shopping around before I applied for my second Loan but felt other companies take too long to approve you online.

If you want a quick turn around which is what I wanted, this company is great!

reviewDescription: I recently opened an avant card. So far, I hate it in comparison to all of my other cards. After using the card I called to get my bill/payment information to see when my 1st bill would be due, and was told to call back during business hours. I could not obtain payment info or make a payment outside of their business hours. A few weeks later while paying bills, I realized I was now a few days late on my 1st payment.. I immediately made the payment and asked for a 1 time late payment waive explaining the reason. The representative put it the request and told me I would hear back later with a decision. Days later I received an e-mail letting me know the late fee waive was denied and to call a 1-800 number if I had further questions. I called the 1-800 # and the representative said he couldn‚Äôt help with any questions concerning this and directed me to email a separate contact. The run around and hassle to even ask a question has been ridiculous compared to any other card I own.
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

Avant contacted me and showed me a way to lower my interest rate while getting more cash at the same time. I refinanced and saved on my monthly payment. It worked out great for me!

After a few years with this company, no past due payments, and finally paying it off, I was cancelled because I was no longer using the card. That caused my Credit Score to drop. The reason I didn't use it was because I live in a city where there is no mail service in the city. Everyone has a PO Box. The first card was sent to that PO Box but the 2nd card never arrived. Now they tell me Avant can't send a card to my PO Box.

UPDATE: There reply is an example of their "service". They have my phone number, so they should call. I "called" their phone number and was told they couldn't help me. Hence, the review. Now, they want me to call them again... so I can be told the same thing all over.
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. I had a $2000 credit limit. Charged items totaling $1400 and ALWAYS paid on time, never late, and the interest was close to 30%. Returned a couple of expensive items a couple of months after purchase totaling $1100. Overnight my credit limit dropped to $300!! They DID NOT send me an email or anything telling me this. I went to use the card and it was denied by the retailer. Looked at the app to see the limit dropped to $300. Called and they gave no excuse, said I'd receive a letter. When the letter FINALLY arrived it said the reason for the decrease was "Credit Card Activity". Apparently, you can't get any refunds without them getting back at you. Since then I quit using the card and paid them off. I will never use that card again! They're not getting $1 interest from me ever again! Avant = Horrible Credit Card! Don't get one.

reviewDescription: Date of experience: August 09, 2023

Advertised "no hard inquiry" pre-approval was not.

Follow-up review based on creditor's reply: The stated order of events clearly did not transpire as the creditor portrays. The fine line between soft and hard credit report inquiries was not obvious nor clear. Had I been offered this option I would have been aware of it.

Curiously enough, I was directed to Avant through Credit Karma and the follow-up emails from CK indicated they were unaware that my 'pre-approval' application was ever completed. There was a disconnect as to whether I had ever initiated an application let alone completed one.

I stand by my original review and believe Avant is aware of the cloudiness of their 'pre-approval' process. It's a shame they feel they need to resort to this type of marketing in order to attract new clients.
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear about your situation. A soft inquiry is conducted upon submission of your inquiry for credit. Please be advised that a soft credit inquiry will not affect your credit score and is not visible to other creditors. However, upon submission of your application for final review, each customer is required to acknowledge and consent to a hard credit inquiry. Note that rates are determined on an individual basis and are based on a number of factors including your credit score and repayment history, among others. If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact us at Support@Avant.com and we will promptly address your concerns.

reviewTitle: I set up a payment plan with Avant to‚Ä¶
reviewDescription:
I set up a payment plan with Avant to catch up on my payments as I have health issues. The plan was selected by the Avant customer service rep. They told me this was what I would have to pay and I would be caught up which I agreed to. I was told my card would stay open and in good standing as well. They also told me there would be interest charges but was not advised that I would also be charged late fees. I was charged for late fees in June, July and August because it was considered late and I didn‚Äôt pay enough to cover the past due. How is that when the customer service rep was the one who told me what payment plan would catch me up? I tried calling to get the late fees waived as it was $39/month. The customer service rep was rude and tried yelling at me, was cutting me off and put me on hold for more than 5 mins at a time. Nothing got resolved. I was told they would ‚Äúfile ‚Äú a claim for me to get the late fee ‚Äúrefunded‚Äù if approved and today I received an email that it was denied.

This is definitely unlawful practice and as I mentioned I was never once warned about late fees. The dates the payments were automatically withdrawn were the dates an Avant rep picked for me stating it would help me get caught up.

I asked to speak to a manager and not one manager came on the phone.

I‚Äôd like to speak to someone who can assist and is professional enough to get these late fees cleared up.
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear about the misunderstanding. We aim to make managing your account as clear as possible. Please email us at Support@Avant.com and we will promptly assist you.

I don't appreciate you reporting that I've used more than half of my credit limit to the credit bureau when I haven't even been given a due date and time to pay. I don't carry balances, the money I used was in my checking account, therefore I could have used my bank account to pay for the services, that I used the card for. I used the card, because that's what its for. Normally banks report your unpaid balances after both the due date and next statement when you've paid your balance, not the very first statement. If I haven't been given a due date, how can I even pay it.when. You made it seem to credit bureaus I carry a balance, and I don't. This lowered my score 12 points!!! Moral of the story wait til your first statement comes out, and you have a due date, before you use this card for any purchases.

reviewTitle: I still haven't received my refund for overpayment to Avant‚Ä¶
reviewDescription:
This was the second loan I have taken from Avant. The second time was much better than the first time because Avant had made a couple of key changes that made repayment easier. My problem with Avant is that I overpaid my loan by $325 when I paid the loan off and I still have not received my refund two weeks later. They told me it could take up to three weeks to have the overpayment deposited into my account. I have a hard time believing this when they make deposits daily.


UPDATE!!!!!!!
I did receive an email today from Avant. It was the same thing they have been telling me that I will receive my refund in 2 - 3 weeks. They really should pay what they owe in a reasonable amount of time. You sure can't pay them late.
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear about the confusion regarding your payoff amount. We'd love to help you get the right information about your account. Please give us a call at 800-712-5407 so that we can resolve this for you.

I called and spoke to Tom in the fraud department on the 18th of June as was told someone would be in touch during the upcoming week to discuss the charge and start the process of investigating and a refund. We it is now Monday the of the week after I was to be called and still haven't be contacted. I just called again and got customer service who 100% refused to transfer me to the fraud department because no one has yet been assigned my case. So if you are looking for customer service if needed this is definitely not the company for you. reviewDescription: I was pre-approved for a loan and lady who helped me with my application over the phone was very kind walking me through it. She stated that decisions on pre-approved accounts are instant but it would take at most 24 hours. I am now on day 5 of trying to get this "pre-approved" loan done but they keep making me go through hurdles. I presented all bank states, pay stubs, offer letter, and they pulled my credit with a hard inquiry. But they still can't decide if I should have it so I should talk to the IRS about my income being tracked for 2023. This isn't possible by the way but they insisted that I call the IRS now for prove me wrong. Well it's a holiday weekend so no one is available until Tuesday. They proceeded to state that I won't have a decision then until next Friday at the earliest and berated me on the phone about not knowing how this works. Ridiculous waste of a hard credit hit for a loan I cancelled due to their bait & switch tactics.
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear about the misunderstanding. After being shown loan options, but before submitting your application for final review, we require acknowledgement that a hard credit inquiry will be performed. We strive to make our application as clear as possible and apologize that we did not meet your expectations. If you have any additional feedback or questions regarding the application process, please contact us at Feedback@Avant.com.

reviewTitle: I would have given a full 5 stars but‚Ä¶
reviewDescription: I would have given a full 5 stars, but the process for approving my loan took much longer than it should have in my opinion, mainly caused by repetitious steps and a bit of a language barrier! I was asked the same set of questions, and answered the same set of questions three different times over about a week long period! And after each set of questions I was asked, I was led to believe that my funds would be deposited into my bank account either later that day, or by the next day. It happened 3 different times and I was told to expect funds at least by the next day, three different times! It was like starting over each time I called, checking to see what the holdup was? The customer service team was very pleasant, but there was unnecessary aggravation there as well, due to very thick accents from an off-shore customer service team! As I said before, they were very nice, but they are trained to repeat literally every word that a customer says to them, after each sentence. It‚Äôs so annoying and makes communication take twice as long, which is an unnecessary waste of time & causes much aggravation! I actually started thinking that they had lost my original loan application or something because I had to verbally reapply every time I called. I almost canceled and went with another bank because of this, but the last time I called , they assured me that I‚Äôd be receiving funds by the next morning, which I did, so no harm done. However there was definitely more aggravation than there had to be. I received a fair rate (for 2023) on my unsecured bill consolidation loan considering the interest rates and market conditions of today! Which is of course insanely high, but it is what it is in 2023.
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear about the misunderstanding. If you have any additional feedback or questions regarding the application process, please contact us at Feedback@Avant.com..

reviewDescription: This company is the worst. I had a deposit account with them, which no longer exists. When the bank closed so did my checking account. Prior to the bank closing, I reported a charge to my account that was over a thousand dollars that were not made by me. The bank investigated and closed the case stating they thought I made the charge. I contact the establishment this charge was made and they agreed that since the charge was clearly not made by me that they would like to return the money but would have needed to return it to the account that was used, which was this now closed account. A week later I received an email from Avant stating that they received the money and would be sending me a check in the mail. This was 3 months ago. I call weekly and am told that they don't have a partnership with some other bank and cant send me a check until they have one. I can't believe this! After never even investigating charges I dispute, they are now holding my money. Is this even legal? I am having a hard time paying for my insulin and this bank has over a thousand dollars of my money. How is this possible?
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewDescription: I had the AVANT card. They "made a mistake" (they later said) and halved my credit limit so I closed my account. The next month I sent them the entire balance owed. The next month I get a bill for $3.63 for interest on the balance because they do daily balance to charge interest and there was 11 days between the beginning of the new cycle and when they received payment. They refused to wave it and I told them that was petty after sending them almost $400 the previous month and that I refuse to pay. The next month they send me a bill for the interest and then a late fee. I just started getting back to fair credit again after a similar fight with BLAZE (which I reviewed here) and they're trashing my score over $7. This company is petty and charges interest even after the account is closed. They could have waved the interest and; thus, not charge me a late fee but they want to ruin people over chump change.

reviewTitle: I would give ZERO stars if I could
reviewDescription:
I would give ZERO stars if I could. What is the point of having this card if you can't use it? Every attempted transaction is deemed to be FRAUD, when it's not.

On February 11, I tried to use this card at a place where I am a regular. I was publicly embarrassed to have it declined. So I used another card to pay my tab.

The next day, I tried to use it at an online delivery app. Declined again. I got an email asking me to call to verify that I made the listed charges. I called, spent forever on hold, and the call got cut off. Called again and finally got the issue solved and my card unfrozen. I thought that was the end of it.

Nope. On Monday, February 20, I tried to use it again with the same delivery app. Declined. Tried again at a different retailer to see if maybe the delivery app was the problem, but declined AGAIN. Now they want me to call AGAIN to fix it.

I understand wanting to protect customers from fraud, but this is BEYOND RIDICULOUS. I have to waste hours calling you every time I want to use this card? No. Not gonna happen. Fix the system on your end, don't waste my time making me fix problems that were not my fault. I've been a good customer, always make my payments on time, I don't deserve to be treated like a criminal.

And don't bother with your canned response telling me to call again. The answer is NO. How do I know that this won't be the end of it? You have issues on your end, fix it and maybe I will remain a customer. As it is now, i will pay this thing down and then it's good riddance. You can't treat honest customers this way and expect them to remain customers.
Easy to do business with.
reviewCompanyResponse: That's great to hear! Thanks so much, Joseph for choosing Avant.

reviewTitle: Not trusted. Don‚Äôt give your personal info
reviewDescription: I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this company. I applied for a small loan, and during my application process, I uploaded all requested documents the same day on the portal. After uploading the documents, I received a green boxing stating ‚Äúcompleted‚Äù. Everyday after I would either receive an email that said ‚Äúplease call AVANT‚Äù or upload a document in which I had already upload. This went on for 6 days, each day I would call and speak to different representatives, informing them all that I had completed those task. They would confirm with me that was accurate and told me ‚Äúwe will process your application and approval could can taken place within the same 24hrs.‚Äù This was my same scenario every day for 6 days. On day 7, I received an email stating that my application had expired and I would have to re-apply. In disbelief I contacted Avant and the representative pretty much read my email to me, before I could even speak to tell her why I was calling. I informed her I would like to know why they dropped they ball? Why did they send the same emails to me daily with task I had already completed. When I asked for a supervisor, I was told they were on the phone with someone else and the representative would schedule a call back for the supervisor to call me‚Ä¶ That call back never happened. Please don‚Äôt waste your time with this company, please don‚Äôt give them your personal information and then receive a soft or hard pull on your credit. They acted as amateurs or a scamming company. I would‚Äôve gave them zero stars if I could have.
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear you're having trouble with the verification process. We make it a goal to accurately verify our customers' identities, so we have a very high standard for documents. If you're continuing to have trouble, please email your documents to us at Apply@Avant.com. Or give us a call at 800-712-5407 if you'd like to discuss the issue you're experiencing.

This company arbitrarily decides it should lower my credit to $750 from $2k after a ‚Äúreview of my credit‚Äù. I called and inquired and customer service they had no reason and that department who makes the decision can‚Äôt take calls. Do you believe this?? I close my account right then and there. I had a $427 balance on what was a $2k credit line and now a $750. My debt to loan ratio was killed.

The next month my credit score drops to 602. This company screwed me over. Fast forward to 5 days before Christmas and I receive this email:
_______________________________________

We recently advised you of a credit line decrease on your account that was based in whole or in part on a low behavior score. After reviewing your account and investigating our reasons for the decrease, we have determined that your credit line should not have been decreased.

If you closed your account as a result of this matter, we cannot reopen your account.

For any questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us at 1-855-752-7012.

Sincerely,

Avant Card Team

Avant branded credit products are issued by WebBank.
24/7 Customer Support
Phone: 855-752-7012
_______________________________________

Beware of Avant and tread lightly

I reviewed the previous conversation with the manager and she says I'll open an investigation. We'll today I got a 90 day late and basically told they aren't going to do anything about it and it's my problem. I have not had any issues with the other 4 accounts i closed. reviewDescription: Not a fast apllication process, it took 10 days to get a rejection (after I told them i wanted an answer the next day or I was going with another company).I applied after a recommendation from Credit Karma. The company did not like that I had 2 different banks and one of my part time jobs paid in paper checks. I can't tell you how many times I was hung up on when I would call to check on my application. They would NOT accept the second job as a second income without being able to prove where I deposited the checks. My credit is fair but trending upward, every payment on time and remarks are all postiive on my credit report. Isn't the point of applying for a consolidation personal loan to consider what the clients are trying to do...get out of debt with the least amount of interest charges and lowering your DTI?! Just say no, and go elsewhere.

reviewDescription:
SCAM! FRAUD! I paid my account in full on 10/4/22. Payment Posted in my bank account 10/5/22. Avant received the payment and it posted, the account was closed down 10/6/22. Avant sent me an email confirming the account was closed down at my request. Without my knowledge! Avant did not close my account and on 10/17/22. I opened up a card account with Avant and started with a $1,500 credit limit. I used it for travel and car rental. My last trip I used $1,400 of my available credit and when I returned home I paid the balance in full before the statement period ended. As, I was preparing for my most recent trip. I attempted to use my card to reserve a car and that's when I learned my available credit had been decreased to $300 with no notice or justification. I've NEVER been late or missed a payment.
So, there was no reason for the decrease or the embarrassment that I was put through. I see from other comments, this is a normal practice of AVANT. This company is a fraud and misleading when having you apply. DO NOT APPLY for a card with them. When they do this it DIRECTLY IMPACTS your credit negatively!!! I'll certainly close my account and stop doing business with this unethical company. I'll also contact the BBB and the states Attorney Generals office. I encourage those with similar experiences to do the same.

reviewTitle: Wrongfully holds funds when payment is made on time.
reviewDescription:
Blocked me from using my funds on 9/26 because of a payment due on 9/25.... Get this, which I paid on the 25th on time. First, I've never had a company block funds because of a late payment by a day, but the facts are that payment was made on time and not late. They can see it in their system as pending and won't unblock until it posts, which we all know takes a couple of business days. So the majority of their customers would have to be having their funds blocked for payments they make on time, on their due date, while their payments are in pending. I even explained I'm visiting my dying dad in ICU and needed a hotel and they refused to do anything even though they can see my payment was made on time. Then, I was told that my payment would go through at the end of the day 9/26 and unblocked for 9/27. I called back 9/27 and it's still blocked, with the agent telling me it's still in pending even though I can see payment posted with a thank you note. I will never ever use this company again and am paying it off and recommend no one else use them. This policy of theirs was not in the terms and conditions when applying for credit.

Edit to reply to Avant's reply: Why would I waste more time calling you when I've called three times and even spoke to a supervisor? My dad is dying, I don't need to waste my time with a company like you who didn't try to make it right several times.
reviewCompanyResponse: We value your feedback, and we are sorry that we have not met your expectations. Please contact us at 800-712-5407. We would love to make it right!

reviewTitle: Avant is shutting down all accounts on 11/30/22
reviewDescription:
Edit 9/30/22 - Avant announced via email that all Avant deposit accounts would be closed by 11/30/22 due to their partnership with Evolve B&T ending. Avant launched their deposit account product in December of 2021, so this product will have existed for less than a year by the time it shuts down. So much for helping underserved people huh? Shutting their bank account down after 9 months.

I will leave the rest of my original review untouched, but this review was written before the shutdown notice was released to any individual customer.

Avant sucks. Never forget that.



I would never ever recommend Avant bank to anyone. Not in a million years.

First off, they trick you into opening an account. Like many of you, I was looking for a credit card for those with low credit scores looking to rebuild their credit. I came across the Avant card and applied for it. After applying, I wasn‚Äôt actually told if I was approved or not, I was just told ‚Äúthanks for applying. We have something else that might help you.‚Äù I actually didn‚Äôt realize this was for a checking account, but wanting the credit card I continued. Then I see I was denied the credit card. So what the heck did I just open? A checking account. Cool, so now I‚Äôm stuck with this checking account I don‚Äôt really want, but if there‚Äôs a chance they can help me achieve a healthier financial life, I thought why not. Moved all my money over, all my bill payments, all my direct deposit, and closed my old checking account. Avant was my future for banking, I guess.

That was just over 2 months ago. Now, about 9 total weeks after opening the account, I‚Äôve closed my Avant checking account and want to warn everyone who might read this to stay the heck away from them.

Continuing with their flaws, this is an anemic checking account. I haven‚Äôt been able to confirm whether or not they actually use Chexsystems, but I would assume they don‚Äôt; in that case, there‚Äôs literally no reason to open this account unless for some reason you‚Äôre not able to open one with Chime or SoFi, two other non-Chexsystems fintech companies that offer completely free feature-rich checking AND savings accounts. Avant deposit accounts are checking-only (no savings account offering whatsoever) with no APY, no Zelle, no checks, no check deposit (mobile or physical), no cash deposit, no physical locations, no peer-2-peer payment system whatsoever, no dedicated bill pay, a really bad ATM system (not even AllPoint offering), and most importantly, really bad account limits. They also code transactions like Cash App and Apple Cash as ‚ÄúATM withdrawals,‚Äù which means that you can kiss goodbye any chance of using your Avant account to pay rent (since there are no checks either), as their ATM limits are hard-capped at $310 unless you‚Äôve been their customer for over a year.

Next, let‚Äôs talk about their support. It basically doesn‚Äôt exist. They‚Äôre a bank that uses a ticket-based customer support system, which should already be a red flag for most people. If it isn‚Äôt, I should tell you now that despite this ticket-based support system, customer support will still go out of their way to waste your time. I was trying to close my account and was asked to give a reason why, as well as to confirm with the last 4 of my SSN and my DOB. I gave them the last 4 and my DOB, and they came back hours later with a copy-paste of the same message asking for a reason why I‚Äôm closing my account. Yes, they make you wait hours for a response but will still pester you for your opinion. Instead of just being a decent customer service representative and processing my request, they had to waste my time one last time before I ceased being their customer. Fantastic job. The most ironic thing was them telling me ‚Äúhere are some reasons you might wanna rethink your decision.‚Äù If there was any chance of me rethinking my decision, it was erased the moment you proved that you have NO respect whatsoever for my time. Aside from that, they have a phone number that you can call that isn‚Äôt 24/7 (no 24 hour line whatsoever), and that‚Äôs it. And just as the icing on the cake, Google is pretty much useless if you have this account; all Google results are tailored to their credit card, so whenever you search ‚ÄúAvant‚Äù or ‚ÄúAvant checking‚Äù with your problem, the ONLY results you‚Äôll receive will either be insanely basic or won‚Äôt be relevant because they‚Äôll be tailored towards another product. So in my mind, this bank account has no value if you value customer support at all.

All in all, Avant‚Äôs checking/deposit account is just kinda pointless. An anemic account with no features, you‚Äôd be far better off with a local credit union or something like SoFi or Chime. With no customer support to back it up, this account is completely pointless and I recommend you look elsewhere if you care about your money.

Thanks for reading!

reviewTitle: I applied for a loan on 8/31 through‚Ä¶
reviewDescription:
I applied for a loan on 8/31 through Regions bank and Avant is their waterfall lender for people with fair credit. I was prequalified with Avant and the initial process was great. My credit score was 630 on 8/31 as I received the letter from Regions showing my credit score on Expiearn and also Transunion.

Here is the part that would make anyone scream... This all took place over a week. Numerous times having to submit documents.

After I submitted the application- I had to sync my bank accounts-Provide paystubs-Provide copies of my IRA statement-Provide my spouse's paystubs. Everything I sent lined up with my application. They requested these documents over the course of a week. When you call you will get zero help- I mean ZERO help.

I tried emailing and my email was not responded to for three days. When it was to was of Zeto help.

When you go to their dashboard to check the status or see what's going on.. all it says is you have things to do and your application is going to expire. But when you call them about it- they say there is nothing you need to do and nothing to turn in continue checking your dashboard, but you do and it says it is about to expire, and yet you need to do nothing. If it expires they have you reapply which is another hard inquiry on your credit report.

I have never written a review before but was so mad about this process I had to share my experience.

I'm sure this company and loan program are and have been wonderful options for many. For me, it was such a runaround and horrible experience.

reviewDescription:
RIDICULOUS HOOPS to jump through

A scammer opened an account in my name through Avant, because they make the process super easy for scammers, and tried to get funds. Those funds were denied apparently. But these are the hoops Avant wants people to jump through for them to acknowledge scammers hurting YOUR CREDIT through THEIR COMPANY PRACTICES.

Don't do business with them. The reviews from customers make it clear Avant will WASTE HOURS of your time to clear up any issues you run into with them.

EMAIL RECEIVED FROM AVANT:

Thank you for contacting Avant. Your account has been forwarded to us because you have indicated that you do not believe you applied for credit from Avant. Avant has been able to locate an account in your name. It is important to note that the application in question has not been funded. However, an inquiry may have been initiated by Avant into your credit profile. Inquiries can affect your credit score and are visible to third parties viewing your credit report. If you still believe you have not applied for credit from Avant, please take the following steps:

1. Print and complete the attached ‚ÄúIdentity Theft Victim‚Äôs Complaint and Affidavit‚Äù (‚ÄúAffidavit‚Äù). The Affidavit must explicitly mention Avant in order to be accepted. You must have the Affidavit (item 22 on page H-6) witnessed by a Notary Public. If you elect not to complete the attached Affidavit, you must file a Law Enforcement Report, described in item 20 on page H-5 of the Affidavit, or an IC3 referral form. The law enforcement Report or IC3 referral form must explicitly reference Avant in order to be accepted. Filing a false Law Enforcement Report may result in criminal prosecution with penalties up to a felony conviction.

2. Deliver the Affidavit, Law Enforcement Report or IC3 referral form and any other supporting evidence of identity theft you may have, to Avant via email, fax or mail.
reviewCompanyResponse: We‚Äôre sorry to hear about your situation. We take allegations of fraud very seriously. Please call us at 800-712-5407 and our specialists would be happy to walk you through our fraud investigation process if you believe this application may have been a result of identity theft.

reviewTitle: I thought this was a good idea...but‚Ä¶

I thought this was a good idea...but no. I applied for an received an Avant card. The very first time I used it, it was declined. When I called, the rep said their systems were down. So I asked where could I go to find out if they were having issues like that before I tried to use it. The answer: No where. Good luck.
Then, when I was able to use it, and went online to pay the bill, I called and asked when would my payment be posted to my account. They said within one day. BUT it would not be considered available credit for 10-15 days. So really you really only have access to the the available credit on the card about 15 days out of the month? Why is it Capital One and Chase can post a payment the day you pay them and Avant needs 15 days. Paid off the card and stuck it in a drawer. Useless.

UPDATE: So I reached out to Avant like their response said and asked how they were going to "fix the situation." And their response was no response. The reply said to email them. And then when I did, they said I had to call. Guess what will happen when I call? This company posts responses to these reviews as a way to seem like they are listening. They are not. Clearly. #reallybadmarketing

reviewDescription: I have meant to cancel this credit card for 5+ years now and just hadn‚Äôt. When the widespread compromise occurred, I received no notification, no information for weeks after I realized it happened. When I initially called they were reassuring, it would be fixed in a timely matter and not reported to the credit bureaus. That was a lie. Do I care that a measly $500 was reported? Not particularly. I do care, however, that they were misleading, or at the very best misinformed and obviously unable to handle such a compromise. To add to that, the second time I called customer service to inquire as to why it had not been resolved in all this time and had been reported despite their convincing reassurance it would not be, the customer service representative used phrases like ‚Äúas I was saying before you interrupted me‚Äù and ultimately hung up on me. Your job is customer service, customer service in a financial institution at that, expect people to be upset when their money is compromised and learn to fix the issue rather than escalating it. I can‚Äôt comment on anything other than that. However, fraudulent charges occurring in the first place, the time is took to resolve, and the absolute lack of professionalism from customer service makes this company an absolute no go from me.

reviewTitle: Avant may be scamming people into becoming unwitting customers
reviewDescription:
Avant has seemingly resorted to spam email campaigns to trick people, whose information they‚Äôve bought from a data broker, into giving them sensitive personally identifiable information so they can claimed these people as customers. This is evident from the fact they show you an avatar, tied to your email address by data brokers, when you enter it. Then, should you reset your password, they ask for your SSN and date of birth, as the SSN allows them to claim you, and birth dates from data brokers may not be reliable.

Do not give them this information! Set a unique/secure password, then exit out of the process. Pull a full credit report to ensure no one has signed up with an account under your name.

I called their support. They told me how they take fraud seriously, and then they hung up on me!!

If any lawyers are looking to form a class-action suit based on this campaign, I‚Äôd love to join.
reviewCompanyResponse: We‚Äôre sorry to hear about your situation. We take allegations of fraud very seriously. Please call us at 800-712-5407 and our specialists would be happy to walk you through our fraud investigation process if you believe this application may have been a result of identity theft.

reviewDescription:
I recv'd this email requesting that I write a review OF THIS 'company' on TrustPilot. Usually, I'm very astute w/who I conduct business with. However, I haven't ever had any correspondence w/this company, so any review relating to their "'quality' of service" would admittedly, lack credibility and be based on falsehood.

I've done consumer advocacy work for over 20 years now, and have written many reviews on several sites. Typically, a legit company doesn't solicit or request that customers review them. That's almost wholly initiated voluntarily. But Avant admittedly caters to low credit score applicants in their issuing of Secured Credit Cards.

However, given that my score is actually exceptional, I'd have absolutely NO USE for their services. My guess, quite frankly, is that they're soliciting Shadow Reviews from unsuspecting applicants in order to bolster their image. Well they've met their match here!!!

Suffice it to say though, not having EVER done business with them B4, doesn't otherwise prevent me from suggesting or stating that I feel that this 'company' is employing a questionable business tactic in their quest to bolster their image for added recognition.

If, however, they reach out to me and can substantiate my actually contacting them, then clearly I'd reconsider this posting, based on what I then learn, and modify this review! My guess though...that'll never happen.

Until then, "Avant" seems a bit SCANT to me!!!

XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
My response to their "Blow-off":
Below this supplement, you'll see what, in effect, is a tacit denial and an outright failure to take responsibility for their predatory marketing practices rather to instead, do what's right and own up to their engagement in these bogus marketing practices that prey on less aware individuals! Maybe the FTC would be interested in their game-plan?!
reviewCompanyResponse: We apologize but this email was sent in error. Rest assured there that you do not have any active applications or products with Avant at this time. We apologize for any confusion this has caused but you can disregard the email.

reviewTitle: There nothing but a bunch of BullCrap
reviewDescription:
REFERENCE #279999
So to start, I have to say that for me having a poor credit rating, they gave me that chance to build myself back up again and even trusted me for a $1500 credit limit to start. Now who ever developed the App is really bad at their job and needs to step down. 1st- it doesn't track your spending with exact change, it rounds it self up to the next dollar so when you get close to your limit, you end up hitting it $15 early. So a few weeks ago I went out of town and ended up using $980. So that should leave me with $520. I'm at home and trying to buy an item online from a timed auction and win. I put in my card numbers to pay and it kept saying declined. It cant be cause of no credit so I don't understand what's going on. I call them up to be told that they're having technical problems and all accounts were frozen. Needless to say, I lost the item and couldn't even use my remaining credit for a full 2 months. I was told as soon as it's fixed that I would receive a email but that never happened. I just randomly discovered it on my own, just past the 2 month mark. What's funny is that they could still do statements, collect your payments for sure and create new Ads to get you to make extra payments to get ahead.
So this month (August) I made an attempt to make 2 early payments and then my monthly payment. The app gave me alot of trouble taking my new card# from my Square account but finally got it, or maybe not. My 2 $50 payments and my $100 one got canceled. Now once I realized it, it's past the due date and I get hit with a $25 late fee. I didn't receive a single email for any of the payment problems, no text, or nothing in my app portal. This is horrible and a super sloppy way to run a financial institution. Stay away and Don't Say That I Didn't Warn You!!!!!
reviewCompanyResponse: That's certainly not what we hope for. We strive to provide the highest level of service every day, and we're very sorry to hear that we didn't get it right this time. Is there any chance you'd call back in? Please call us at 800-712-5407 or write to us at Support@Avant.com. We'd love a chance to fix this situation.

reviewTitle: If i could give them a zero I would
reviewDescription:
If i could give them a zero I would. I just did their "soft" application to see my options. When I saw their pathetic options I quickly closed the site and asked them to delete my account. THE WILL NOT. They want to keep your info to sell and other marketing. Here is their response exactly.

"Thank you for submitting a data request. Avant is dedicated to the principles of transparency and fair processing of personal information. Due to Avant's current information collection practices, we are unable to honor your request. As an applicant for a credit product through the Avant platform, the information we have collected about you is subject to the Gramm-Leach Bliley Act. We are not required to disclose or delete such information and Avant is permitted to use such information for our legitimate business purposes, such as fulfilling our legal and compliance obligations. "

Do NOT use this company. Not only do they prey on those with average credit, but they will sell your information to everyone!
reviewCompanyResponse: We're sorry to hear that you had such a bad experience. We believe all customers deserve equal access to responsible financial products. We want you to know that we take any claims of discrimination very seriously. Please give us a call at 800-712-5407 so we can get to the bottom of this.

reviewDescription:
I applied for a loan for $10,500 with them a week ago. The process was ridiculous. They will NOT email you when you need to update anything, and they will not call. You will have to keep checking your application if it needs to be updated. I applied last Wednesday night, about 4pm. I called on Friday to check the status and they kept speaking quick and he said he needed to submit it for review and is there anything else he could help me with, he tried to get me to hang up, but I stayed on the line. 20 minutes later he comes back and asks why my paystub comes from a different company and not mine, I had to explain this to him. After that, another THREE days they sent me an email to call them, and they told me my paystub bank account did not match the bank account I gave them. It was completely false, I literally had to walk them through the difference between a routing number and an account number. This took AN HOUR. Also they don't speak clear english. Finally resolving it they took another day to post I need to verify other income to get to the right Net income, which was not correct because my net income was already OVER what they pre-approved me with. I think it was just stalling at this point because I submitted my husbands checks asap and they let it sit again without updating it. Then today I get an email that my loan application EXPIRED, and I would have to reapply. I have NO interest in getting a loan through this company anymore. I think they just collect your information for fraud reasons and then go about their day. No sense of urgency with them. You will not get a loan approved before it expires. Every review I have read that seems real, they all have the SAME issues.

UPDATE: I will not be giving them a second chance. I secured a different loan on better terms from Prosper in 24 hours.

reviewTitle: I am a previous customer with Avant
reviewDescription:
I am a previous customer with Avant. They gave me a personal loan when I was really financially stressed. I was able to pay off the loan 2 years in advance. After several months, they started sending me emails to apply for another loan. I finally did on 7/20/22. Unlike the first experience, this one was a nightmare. They kept asking for the same documents over and over. Each time I submitted the documents, they would say I didn‚Äôt need to do anything else, but they would never say whether or not the loan was approved. Finally after 7 days, I received an email saying my application had expired and I could re-apply! So I did on 7/28/22. I got the same run around with the document requests but no follow-up from Avant. After a couple days, I just told them to cancel my application. I was frustrated. Not because I didn‚Äôt get the loan, but because they weren‚Äôt professional enough to let me know one way or another. I felt like just another piece of paper, rather than a person. If that‚Äôs the way they treat people, I‚Äôm glad I don‚Äôt have to do business with them. Oh, by the way, before I paid off the previous loan, I paid every payment on time.

Helen R. Richmond
